item.title: take notes to understand your language
item.description: There probably wasn’t one person who looked up and said, “Oh well, that is obviously the ‘sky’.” Even if they did, how did that word become so prolific in the English language? “Sky” was written and rewritten, whispered and proclaimed throughout history, eventually becoming ingrained in everyday speech. It is believed that the word “sky” has a Germanic origin, traceable to the Old English word “sceo” or “sceoh,” which meant “cloud” or “cover.
